text: Is there any boilerolate template for email-development ?
Glad you got it sorted out. You could also use `{% raw %} code {% endraw %}`

Right now thereâ€™s no way to locally edit drag-and-drop emails, but traditional emails can be managed with the CLI. I usually will create a template in the design manager, pull it down, and then modify from there.

*Looking for Programmable Email Examples*
Hi All! My name is Shane and I am the Product Manager for the Email Marketing tool. We are looking for examples from customers who have published emails with the Programmable Email feature. We would love to see some examples of your emails and hear from you and how it is going. Please DM me if you have used the feature at all since release. Thanks in advance.
S

Hi there! I'm looking for help setting up my first email template to be dark mode friendly using the drag-and-drop template in Design Tools (not the editor)... I'm not sure if we are adding the code the correct way to make the logo dark mode friendly. Here's how I have it set up (attached - the code shown is how it appears in the "additional <head> markup" ), but it isn't working and nothing is showing up in the HTML of a test email either. Any suggestions? Perhaps creating a fully customized template is the way to go. I'll also search this feed in the case this has been answered already.
<@UCDCS9KCP> this is what I'm trying to do.
Which email client are you testing in?
Hi <@UKGV272KS> I tested across several. The problem is that both logos appear regardless (instead of show one or the other) so something is wrong with my code, I think. Do you spot anything?
Have you looked at <https://www.litmus.com/blog/the-ultimate-guide-to-dark-mode-for-email-marketers/>? I'm not sure looking at the screenshots if it's a dark mode code issue, or a HubSpot issue.
HubSpot just referred me here. We've reviewed this, but still haven't found resolve.
